definition.name: Cache
definition.description: Cache artifacts like dependencies and build outputs to improve workflow execution time
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: A list of files, directories, and wildcard patterns to cache and restore

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: An explicit key for restoring and saving the cache

inputs.name: restore-keys
inputs.description: An ordered multiline string listing the prefix-matched keys, that are used for restoring stale cache if no cache hit occurred for key. Note `cache-hit` returns false in this case.

inputs.name: upload-chunk-size
inputs.description: The chunk size used to split up large files during upload, in bytes

inputs.name: enableCrossOsArchive
inputs.description: An optional boolean when enabled, allows windows runners to save or restore caches that can be restored or saved respectively on other platforms

inputs.name: fail-on-cache-miss
inputs.description: Fail the workflow if cache entry is not found

inputs.name: lookup-only
inputs.description: Check if a cache entry exists for the given input(s) (key, restore-keys) without downloading the cache

inputs.name: save-always
inputs.description: Run the post step to save the cache even if another step before fails

outputs.name: cache-hit
outputs.description: A boolean value to indicate an exact match was found for the primary key
